aws::graph::propositions: # Amazon Fulfillment Network and Data Center Operational Risks
Amazon faces risks related to successfully optimizing and operating its fulfillment network and data centers.
Failures to adequately predict customer demand result in excess or insufficient fulfillment capacity.
Failures to adequately predict consumer spending patterns result in excess or insufficient fulfillment capacity.
Failures to optimize fulfillment network operations can result in service interruptions.
Failures to optimize fulfillment network operations can result in increased costs.
Failures to optimize fulfillment network operations can result in impairment charges.
Failures to optimize data center operations can result in excess or insufficient data center capacity.
Failures to optimize data center operations can result in service interruptions.
Failures to optimize data center operations can result in increased costs.
Failures to optimize data center operations can result in impairment charges.
Operational failures in fulfillment networks or data centers could materially harm Amazon's business.
Amazon continues to add fulfillment capability with different requirements.
Amazon continues to add data center capability with different requirements.
Amazon continues to add new businesses with different requirements.
Amazon's fulfillment networks become increasingly complex as Amazon adds new capabilities and businesses.
Amazon's data center networks become increasingly complex as Amazon adds new capabilities and businesses.
Operating complex fulfillment and data center networks becomes more challenging.
There is no assurance that Amazon will be able to operate its networks effectively.
Failure to optimize inventory management in Amazon's fulfillment network increases net shipping cost.
Failure to optimize inventory management increases shipping distance for products.
Failure to optimize inventory management reduces the number of units per shipment or delivery.
Failure to optimize staffing in Amazon's fulfillment network increases net shipping cost.
Amazon may be unable to adequately staff its fulfillment network.
Amazon may be unable to adequately staff its customer service centers.
Amazon's co-sourcers may be unable to adequately staff Amazon's fulfillment network.
Amazon's co-sourcers may be unable to adequately staff Amazon's customer service centers.

text:
##### We Face Risks Related to Successfully Optimizing and Operating Our Fulfillment Network and Data Centers

Failures to adequately predict customer demand and consumer spending patterns or otherwise optimize and operate our fulfillment network and data centers successfully from time to time result in excess or insufficient fulfillment or data center capacity, service interruptions, increased costs, and impairment charges, any of which could materially harm our business. As we continue to add fulfillment and data center capability or add new businesses with different requirements, our fulfillment and data center networks become increasingly complex and operating them becomes more challenging. There can be no assurance that we will be able to operate our networks effectively.

In addition, failure to optimize inventory management or staffing in our fulfillment network increases our net shipping cost by increasing the distance products are shipped and reducing the number of units per shipment or delivery. We and our co-sourcers may be unable to adequately staff our fulfillment network and customer service centers.
